title: Virtual Environment-Based Science Assessment and Language Proficiency Enhancement Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Scientific Concepts and Digital Device Utilization Skills
context.additional_context: Utilization of virtual assessment tools and application of language-science integrated pedagogical approaches in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Learners can descriptively document the process of designing science experiments and verifying hypotheses in a virtual laboratory.

In a virtual environment-based assessment simulation (e.g., Labster, VR science labs), learners perform three scientific inquiry activities (observation, hypothesis formation, experimental design). They achieve an average of 4 or higher on a 5-point rubric per activity and write a quantitative results report (including data visualization).
Learners can enhance academic language proficiency in accurately explaining scientific terminology and experimental procedures.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
